author: Christoph
message:
Oh, Blogilo went to the UI clinic ;)

Regarding the docker, I really like Dolphin's ability to "lock" the dock windows (and thereby hiding the title and buttons), so you have both the possibility to move them to the left side, and the possibility to save space.

author: Aurélien
message: Locked dockers indeed look nicer, but when your application has only one dock I think it's even better to use a splitter. There is not much to gain from being able to move the dock to the left or to the right and the close button can be a bit dangerous as it is one-way only: it makes it easy to close a dock but provides no way to bring it back, you must provide a menu-item/toolbar-button to do so. This element you add is nicer IMO because it is not one-way only.
